TEXT.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
TEXT.source: ['12. rarakeh、kanakan a ka no cai', '老人、小孩和龍眼', 'An old man, children, and longans', '', 'si apen Yohani (F, 49, Iranmilek)', '江秀玉，女，49，東清村', '']

S.FORM: asa ka ciri-ciring da, ci-cilo-an ko do ili ta ya Jiranmilek ya am.
S.TRANSL: 另有一篇故事，也是在我們這個東清村裡聽到的故事
There is one more story that is also a story we heard in Jiranmilek village.

S.FORM: iya rana ori am, ni-mapa-lolo so apo na a ráko a ra-rakeh, ta aro ni-z-om-si a kamazacigi [ciai am.
S.TRANSL: 在一個龍眼盛產期間，有一個老人帶了他的孫子一起上山去
Once when the longans were in season, an old man took his grandson up into the mountains.

S.FORM: ma-ngay na cita-en o pi-moa-moa-n da am, ni-maci-ang-angay o pi-moa-moa-n da mal-asi a.
S.TRANSL: 他曾去看過他們的果樹，結果和別人的果樹一樣，結了很多的果實
Last time he went to look, their tree was the same as the others with a lot of fruit,

S.FORM: karaan am, pa-lolo-en na o asa ka apo na ma-ngay do takey am, alíkey pa o apo na ori a.
S.TRANSL: 後來他就帶著他的小孫子一起上山去了，他的那個孫子還很小
so he took his grandson with him up the mountains. His grandson was still very small.

S.FORM: ma-sásnad sira ori do moa-moa da ori am, ikongodo ji ma-kara-kara-rahan o ráko a ra-rakeh a akay na ori a, one-oned na no rako a ra-rakeh ori am,
S.TRANSL: 他們抵達果園以後，由於老祖父不會爬樹，所以心想，
When they got to the orchard, since the grandfather couldn’t climb, he thought,

S.FORM: “ikong ko ni-pa-lolo-an si Apo ya, do ya ko ka-pa-saray sia no akma si Apo ya so ya ko i-vazay sia moa-moa namen ya” koan na.
S.TRANSL: “我帶孫子來的目的是什麼呢，就是要讓他高興，讓他看看我們的龍眼樹果實纍纍的情形” 他說
“I brought my grandson here to see the fruit-filled trees in order to make him happy.”

S.FORM: ni-pa-lolo na zaig a pa-ni-sibo na a zaig ori am, zasa-en na rana o asa atngeh aka mazacigi ang.
S.TRANSL: 之後，他用帶來的斧頭開始砍下那棵龍眼樹
He used his hatchet that he had brought to work in the mountains to chop down the longan tree,

S.FORM: ta ji na a-rahan ori, ta ji ma-kara-kara-rahan ori a.
S.TRANSL: 因為他爬不上去，也不會爬樹
because he couldn’t climb up and didn’t know how to climb.

S.FORM: karaan am, todaji mi-ígen rana am ma-zasa rana ori, koanata, ma-key-kái a ma-zasa o rako a kayo ori.
S.TRANSL: 快到中午時才把樹砍倒了。當然啦，小斧頭砍大樹本來就是件不容易的事
Near noon the tree finally fell. Of course, cutting down a tree with a hatchet is not an easy thing to do.

S.FORM: m-ównay am, ma-zasa na rana o rako a kayo ori am, i-saray na rana no ra-rakeh ang,
S.TRANSL: 很久以後，才把樹砍倒了，老人家心裡為此感到很高興
It took a while to cut down the tree. Once it fell, the old man was happy.

S.FORM: am-ian so ta-tlo a pa-pat aka k-anak-an a ni-man-mo-mosi dang am, mi ma-nilo so paha-pahad am.
S.TRANSL: 當時，有三四個去山上捉昆蟲，捕蝴蝶的小孩子
There were also three or four children catching bugs and butterflies at the same time.

S.FORM: to da a-cita o ni-ma-naza-saza asa kayo a asa tngeh a mazacigi ori am,
S.TRANSL: 正好遇到了那棵才剛被砍倒的龍眼樹
When they saw the fallen longan tree,

S.FORM: ta! koan no k-anak-an, ya m-ian dang so ya mapi-moa-moa sia, ya mapi-apongod sia koan da.
S.TRANSL: 呵，小孩子哪管果樹是否有主人或擁有者在不在場的？
They were so ecstatic that they didn’t even think if the owner of the fruit tree was there.

S.FORM: ori a ka-to da ngomon-an do dang a kan-en no pa-pat aka k-anak-an ori am.
S.TRANSL: 四個小孩就潛入那龍眼樹下開始猛吃
The four kids went over and started filling themselves up with longans.

S.FORM: ciai am, ya ji a-ráko o ya na avong-an no voo-voong no rako a ciai ori.
S.TRANSL: 那棵龍眼樹枝葉長得茂密，遮蔭的範圍也很大
The longan tree had long and dense leaves, and the shadow was very large.

S.FORM: karaan am, to sira ngomon do voo-voong no ciai ori a k-om-an a, ji sia mi-zi-ziak sira ori a, ta i-ka-niahey da
S.TRANSL: 他們深怕被發現，所以就在龍眼的樹葉遮掩下靜靜的吃龍眼
They were afraid of detection, so they hid under the longan tree and ate silently.

S.FORM: o ito ori o yan-an da no ra-roa aka miakay ori ori a, am-ian sira do jia o ka-k-anak-an a k-om-an ori a, cita-cita-en da sira ori a.
S.TRANSL: 就像這樣（比劃），祖孫倆的位置在那裡，偷吃龍眼的那些小孩則在這裡。他們隨時注意那祖孫倆（移動位置的情形）
If the grandfather and his grandson were on one side, they would be on the other. They constantly looked at the position of the two.

S.FORM: ano to sia mipá-ngay do jia o ra-roa aka miakay ori am, to sia a-talihódhod sira ori o k-anak-an a ma-kma sito a k-om-an ori ori a.
S.TRANSL: 每當祖孫倆往這個方向移動時，那些小孩就跟著移轉位置繼續吃龍眼
As soon as the pair started in their direction, the four would wind around to the other side and continue eating.

S.FORM: to sia a-talihódhod a, to sia maká-sngen am, to sia a-talihódhod a.
S.TRANSL: 兩方都循著相同的方向前進，當祖孫倆快接近他們時，他們也往前移動
Both parties moved in the same direction, and when the pair neared the four, the four would move forward.

S.FORM: ma-níring o rako a ra-rakeh ori am:
S.TRANSL: 老人家說
The old man said,

S.FORM: “ya ka pa ji a-bsoy ori, mo koimo a, o ito a ya pa ji a-navak o aomas ta, mo koimo a,
S.TRANSL: “喂！你還沒有吃飽啊，你看我們網袋，採收的龍眼半袋都不到
“Grandson, You’re still not full? Look at how much longan we got. Not even half a bag.

S.FORM: ji ka toda ngan a, ájin pa jito a, na k-aro no asi na ori am, mo to mimín-a a kan-en ori a,
S.TRANSL: 你不要吃個不停的，你看哪裡還有（龍眼）？剛才看的時候果實還滿多的啊，難道都被你吃掉了？
Don’t keep on eating because there isn’t that much left. There was a lot before, but it all went into your stomach?

S.FORM: ikong pa o i-oli ta da kaka mo da wari mo, a da ama mo?” “a, ya, i”
S.TRANSL: 我們還拿什麼回家給你兄弟姊妹還有你的父親他們吃呢” ，孫子只是吱吱唔唔的“啊..呀..咿”
What can I take home to your brothers, sisters, and your father?” “I..uh..” the grandson muttered, not wanting to tell the truth.

S.FORM: ma-níring sira o li-líkey a ka-k-anak-an do ikoa am, to da mapa-sila-siláp-i o k-anak-an ang.
S.TRANSL: 那些（藏在龍眼樹下的）孩子們斜眼瞪著那個小孩（小孫子）說
The four children (hiding under the longan tree) glared at the grandson and said,

S.FORM: “ta si i-panci mo pala yamen, si mi-zi-ziak ka pala.”
S.TRANSL: “你敢說是我們，你就試試看 ”
“If you dare utter a word, then ”

S.FORM: pi-pipangayan na no ’oya-an da nia am, i-pa-sta da do k-anak-an ori o moi-moing da ori.
S.TRANSL: 他們對他擺出生氣的臉色就是要警告那個小孫子的意思
This was written on their faces.

S.FORM: am to na rana a-ténng-i no k-anak-an o ka-ji na manci-an nia do akay na. “me.. me.., síno ya ni-k-om-an? síno ya ni-k-om-an” koan na no líkey a k-anak-an ori.
S.TRANSL: 那個小孫子自然是領會了他們的意思，所以他也不敢告訴他的祖父。只是吞吞吐吐的說，“嗯..嗯..我哪有吃，我哪有吃”
The boy knew what they were trying to say, so he didn’t dare tell his grandfather. All he said was, “Uh.. I didn’t eat any, I didn’t eat any!”

S.FORM: ta ji na pa-toaw ori o akmi 四,五個小孩 do karakoan no pa-mozas-an da ori am, ji na manci-i nia.
S.TRANSL: 他不敢說出在樹的另一邊有四個小孩子正吃龍眼的事情
He didn’t dare talk about the four kids on the other side eating their longans.

S.FORM: “taon a, ya na k-aro no asi na ori do ya ko ni-tangara-an sia am, ásio ya? to ngapéreh ori a?”
S.TRANSL: “奇怪，我剛才往樹上看的時候果實很多的啊，摘下來怎麼變少了呢？”
“That’s weird. I saw a lot before. What happened? Why is it that there seems to be less than when I picked them?”

S.FORM: karaan am, kala-kala-en na rana penga-pengay-in na rana do tey-rahem o ma-vozas am, ásio o ma-vozas?
S.TRANSL: 於是他就撥開葉子欲撿掉落在地上的龍眼，可是哪有掉下來的？
There should always be some fallen ones, but when he looked inside the mat of branches, not one fallen fruit was to be seen.

S.FORM: ta o aro a ka-k-anak-an a k-om-an sia do karakoan na ori am, to ngian do aro a ka-k-anak-an a mi-kay-kayoba jia?
S.TRANSL: 早已被小孩子搶著吃掉了，哪裡還有可撿的？
They were already finished off by the kids, so of course there aren’t any fallen ones.

S.FORM: ji sia mi-zi-ziak sira ori o k-anak-an ori a.
S.TRANSL: 那些小孩子都不敢出聲
It’s only that the kids didn’t make a sound.

S.FORM: koanata, k-om-oan pa, manga takzes a, wájin pa, ya pa ji a-navak o ya namen ni-vozas do ya nio ka-ngay maci-akan a,
S.TRANSL: 我說嘛，我們採收了老半天，網袋卻裝不到一半？原來是被你們這些小鬼吃掉了
We picked for so long and didn’t understand why we didn’t even have half a bag. Now I know it was you brats eating them.

S.FORM: todey maci-yoba jiamen a k-om-an, kamo maci-moa-moa jiamen ya, manga koinio?”
S.TRANSL: 你們沒有參與種植這龍眼樹，憑什麼跟我們爭吃龍眼呢？”
Why did you take the longans? Did you help me plant the tree?”

S.FORM: ji sia ori mi-zi-ziak o k-anak-an am, ma-ngay rana sira ori am, ma-sáray rana sira m-ike-yka-miying rana.
S.TRANSL: 他們不講話。走了以後卻很開心的大笑
They didn’t dare utter a sound. Once they left, though, they were laughing happily.

S.FORM: “ayoy, ta ma-bsoy tamo rana ori, ta tamo todey maci-sarow do aro a ciai a da ni-zasa ori, a oyod a ma-bsoy tamo” koan da am, ma-sáray rana sira ori a.
S.TRANSL: “太好了，我們都吃飽了，怎麼那麼巧就被我們遇到砍倒的龍眼樹啊，讓我們吃的飽飽的” 。小孩子都興高采烈的談說吃龍眼的事情
“We finally filled our stomachs, and those were great. What a coincidence to see someone cutting down a longan tree and let us fill our stomachs,” the kids said happily.

S.FORM: ta ásio o m-avaw nokakoa? apia o k-anak-an no ma-ngay sira do take-takey am, apia sira ta to sira ngan so ese-esem am,
S.TRANSL: 以前，哪有多餘的食物；如果小孩子喜歡上山倒還好，他們可以吃些秋海棠之類的東西（來填飽肚子）
There weren’t any snacks before. But if the kids went into the mountains, they could look for bogonia and such (to fill their stomachs).

S.FORM: no maka-sita sira so asi-asi no kayo-kayo am, ori o i-ka-bsoy no ma-ni-sibo a k-anak-an ya am,
S.TRANSL: 或者如果看到果實也可以摘下來吃，所以會上山的小孩子都可以填飽肚子
If they saw fruit, those kids going into the mountains would pick some to fill their stomachs.

S.FORM: ori o i-ka-pia no maka-ahas-en a k-anak-an ya, ta aro o kane-kanen do take-takey a pa-nila-an no k-anak-an am,
S.TRANSL: 所以喜歡上山的小孩子很好，因為山上很多可採可撿的東西吃
In this way, those who liked to go to the mountains were fortunate, for they could find many good things to eat.

S.FORM: ma-le-lma ka-k-anak-an am, ikong to da ngán-a do ili? o ka-pi-aw-awat da saon do ili am, ikong o kan-en da do ili?
S.TRANSL: 但是懶惰的孩子呢，待在村莊裡能吃什麼？他們也只是游游泳而已，他們在村裡能吃什麼？
For those that were lazy, there was no food on the streets. They could only go swim around because there was nothing in the village to eat.

S.FORM: no m-oli sira, k-abo pa no niapoan da ma-notong so kan-kanen da am,
S.TRANSL: 如果回到家裡後，他們的父母親還沒有回來煮飯
If they went back home, their parents weren’t home yet and couldn’t cook.

S.FORM: s-om-yak sira mi-yowyaw do k-abo no kanen am, iweywawalam no k-anak-an nokakoa ya, do.. am ori na kavos-an rana no nang a,
S.TRANSL: 他們只好再出去玩耍，因為他們沒有飯吃，這就是以前的小孩子的情形。這故事我就講到這裡。
The only thing they could do was play because there was nothing to eat. The kids passed their lives like this before. This is the end of my story.

S.FORM: ta “ayoy ta ma-zasa ka rana, ta maka-rilaw si Apo a ya ma-kcin ito” koan na am, mi da rana pa-mozas-an ori a miakay a.
S.TRANSL: 祖父說“太好了，總算把你砍倒了；否則，我那可憐的孫子已餓了” ，然後他們祖孫倆就開始採龍眼了
“Great, I finally felled you! My poor grandson is famished from waiting.” Then they began to pick longans from the tree.

S.FORM: aspáng-an na rana sira ori no rako a ra-rakeh am, “a inio ori, manga tamazang a,
S.TRANSL: 直到老人遇到了他們，才說“啊喲，原來是你們這些小鬼呀
Until the old man saw them and said, “Oh, so it was you brats.

S.FORM: ori rana am, si akay mo icialaw ori a, si aman Panakpen o ni-pa-lolo na ang.
S.TRANSL: 我說那個被帶去山上吃龍眼的小孫子就你的祖父si aman Panakpen
The grandson that I talked about was your grandfather si aman Panakpen.
